text: Is there any way to create contact using Ajax? I am facing CORS issue with Ajax call.
yes with api, let me a min to post the url

Its called Swytch based on angular

you have code example on In the endpoint tab on different langage,
If you have an issue feel free to post on the community board : <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations>
You can tag me in the post with @quentin_lamamy
yes <@U01DF3PNCKA>_lamamy i have that, but i was giving CORS error with AJAX Call
which one ?
dump it here

jquery.min.js:4 Cross-Origin Read Blocking (CORB) blocked cross-origin response <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?hapikey=APIKEY=jQuery112405225626703120907_1604056552499&company=Biglytics&email=bcooper%40biglytics.net&firstname=Bryan&lastname=Cooper&phone=(877)+929-0687&website=biglytics.net&_=1604056552500> with MIME type application/json. See <https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5629709824032768> for more details.

Is there anywhere a A to Z guide with copy-paste examples how to build a app. Cause half the steps seems to be missing or unclear to me.

Following the “getting started” sample-app instructions does not do the job for me :sweat_smile:

_for context, i build a module that outputs schema for products, and want to turn that thing into an app so i can install it for all our clients_
<@U01D8GPG3C7> your url is strange, what is this ‘=jQuery1124....’ ?
<@U015V8UGJ1E> What do you want to achieve ?

Main thing is learning how app’s work.

And i’m trying to do that by (what i guess is the way?) building a app that (in the end) contains a module that spits out structured data.
an app in HubSpot or something external which interact with HubSpot ?
I think i need to make a app in HubSpot for that. Or is there a better way to sync modules between clients?
well my skill field is more on using api and sdk, for module their will be more skilled people on the <#CFPRTEGTX|modules> channel or on the community portal <https://community.HubSpot.com/>
Thanks gentlemen. My guess was i need a app for that, as there is no way of syncing modules between clients (last time i checked was a couple months ago tho)
i’m really sorry to not be able to help you on this point, i’m still learning through my professional project and don”t work at the moment with module
No worries, we cant know everything :slightly_smiling_face:

<@U015V8UGJ1E> and <@U01DF3PNCKA> This is an intentional restriction of the HubSpot APIs since they require authentication, we block them from working from the front end to not have anyone expose their authentication credentials (api key or access token). YOu’ll need to proxy your requests through a server to get them to work.

Not from client side

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/do-HubSpot-apis-support-ajax-request>

It won't work in AJAX

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/do-HubSpot-apis-support-ajax-request>

As a career long security engineer I support this. Otherwise everything would descend into madness.

We should note the ONLY API which is exempt is Form Submit, which can be useful in some cases.
<@U01BBV0L2CF> Thank you for the excellent feedback.  I’ll try a filter instead of search.
I get the following error - HubSpotException: This hapikey (<key>) does not have proper permissions! (requires all of [contacts-write]. Where will I add the permission? Thanks!

For `hapikey` specifically, that could be a licensing challenge on the account from where you retrieved the `hapikey`. If it's working on developing an OAuth / App, then it would be that you did not ask for enough OAuth scopes when you provisioned the app, relative to the APIs it calls. You have to read every API you call, and the API docs of that API, and ask for the Scopes that the docs say that API requires, and then reprovision the app with the right privileges.
Recommend using <https://developers.HubSpot.com/get-started> to get a Dev account and see what you can repro in there
The scopes are set here - not sure where contacts-write is.

Hi there! I have a question about forms in HubSpot. I create a form in HubSpot using the form create API. And one of the fields is `Annual income` but when the form is created, the form shows that property name is `annual income` ( lower cased). This happened with one of the fields too.
My question is, does HubSpot always lower case the property names in forms?
Hi <@U01D082TG9J> - default lower case is only for the internal name of the field, which stays within your HubSpot account. The visible field will show up as the way you want it to be.
